body.prompt: Respond to this question and explain your answer. Complete the sentence using one word: Roses are red, violets are

choices.text:
Blue.

I chose "blue" because it's a traditional completion of the rhyme in the classic English nursery rhyme "Roses are red, violets are blue." However, I should note that the original rhyme is often more like "Roses are red, violets are fine" or just "fading," as the line has undergone slight variations over time. But a common and widely-accepted completion of the rhyme indeed uses "blue" to complete the metaphor with roses being typically associated with the color red.
